author: Phil
content:
Recently watching Right This Minute, Russia was breaking through ice to rescue a stuck ship in the Arctic.

What can I say, We are falling behind.

author: Jan Christensen
content: Good to hear, but WAY past due and too long in coming.

author: Rick Spilman
content:
You are right. It appears that azipods are in the new design. It is difficult to conceive how azipod propulsion is a good idea for a heavy icebreaker. That being said, apparently, a number of modern icebreaking vessels are now using azipods.

https://new.abb.com/marine/generations/technology/azipod-propulsion-ideal-for-ice-management

author: D. Peter Boucher, Kt. SMOM, International Master Mariner
content:
There were remarks in another maritime news source that the USCG icebreaker would have Azipod power units. If this is true it seems a remarkably unwise choice considering the many problems aboard cruise ships with these same units. I have served in both icebreakers and cruise ships but not with Azipods.

Good Watch
